title: StateTests/stRecursiveCreate.json TestStateRecursiveCreate panics in core/execution.go
body:
**NOTE: this file passes in go-ethereum develop, but not when using StateTests/stRecursiveCreate.json from latest ethereum/tests develop branch.** 

@CJentzsch added TestStateRecursiveCreate in the file recently

When running TestStateRecursiveCreate we get

```
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/execution.go:41
```

(full stack trace below)

The odd thing is that it looks like the address is always nil when that function is called, so I don't understand how it was working before.

This test works back at tag v0.8.5-2 so I did a git bisect which tells us:

```
The first bad commit could be any of:
1c872ddf4b1db51847a5d9d020e13d432e847f52
f08e9cbe42dcb067affe0ca1077285ba1b583c95
a7750c929b926d164195fd4f7a7e2b4642c66173
```

It gives those 3 because I had to skip a few due to non-compiling tests, verifying manually gives that the last commit where this test passes is https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/commit/6284604b52e075e454e61f2933cadaaf9ded364b

and the first failing one is https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/commit/a7750c929b926d164195fd4f7a7e2b4642c66173

@obscuren Do you know what went wrong there?

Stack trace: (it keeps looping the same function, so the rest of the trace repeats)


Assuming this is a create (since it ends up in create) this is the path:
- https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/develop/tests/helper/vm.go#L123 pass `nil` as addr
- https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/develop/tests/helper/vm.go#L92 which passes `nil` as addr to the vm creation. so `execution.address == nil`
  This means that when `exec` is called (which happens in `execution.Create`):
- https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/develop/core/execution.go#L58
- which sets `execution.address` to https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/develop/core/execution.go#L65
- which should, after it returned, work in the case of https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/develop/core/execution.go#L41

This is the code which gets called: https://github.com/ethereum/cpp-ethereum/blob/develop/test/libethereum/StateTestsFiller/stRecursiveCreateFiller.json#L49

So basically it is a recursive loop, executing CREATE in the init code. And in the init code we again have a CREATE .... . It should fail after it reaches the 1024 call/create stack limit depth, and just return 0.
I see the bug. Explained to @Gustav-Simonsson
